title: Why the world needs charter cities
description: How can a struggling country break out of poverty if it's trapped in a system of bad rules? Economist Paul Romer unveils a bold idea: "charter cities," city-scale administrative zones governed by a coalition of nations. (Could Guantánamo Bay become the next Hong Kong?)
author: Paul Romer
keywords: TED, talks, business, cities, culture, economics, global issues, politics
